quarks.runtime.jobregistry

Class JobEvents

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.runtime.jobregistry.JobEvents

  • public class JobEvents
extends java.lang.Object
    A source of job event tuples.

    A stream of job event tuples is created by a listener which subscribes to a JobRegistryService.

    • Method Detail

      • source

        public static <T> TStream<T> source(Topology topology,
                                    BiFunction<JobRegistryService.EventType,Job,T> wrapper)
        Declares a stream populated by JobRegistryService events.

        The job registry is passed as a runtime service. At startup JobRegistryService#addListener() is called by the runtime to subscribe an event listener. The listener invokes the given wrapper function to construct a tuple from a job event and submits the tuple on the returned stream.

        When the topology's execution is terminated, JobRegistryServic#removeListener() in invoked to unsubscribe the tuple source from the job registry.

        Parameters:
        topology - the stream topology
        wrapper - constructs a tuple from a job event
        Returns:
        new stream containing the tuples generated by the specified wrapper.
        See Also:
        Topology.getRuntimeServiceSupplier(), JobRegistryService.addListener(BiConsumer), JobRegistryService.removeListener(BiConsumer)
